feed.title: SAP Community - Cloud Connector
feed.subtitle: Cloud Connector Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP API PROXY principal propagation error 403
entry.content:
Greetings SAP community,

I have been trying to expose an ODATA service on our on-premsis ECC system through Integration Suite's API Proxy.

I configured all the nesscary steps between BTP and SCC, SCC and the back-end system so that the identity is forwarded to SCC and then to the back-end system by X.509.

I have confirmed that Principal Propagation works as i use it in a Destination Configuration with SAP Graph and it forwards the identity correctly, requests are executed sucessfully.

However when i try to send a request through API Proxy, i recieve an error 403. API Management isnt exactly clear on how the request should be sent to the proxy, whether it should contain a specific header or a token. I have tried to send the JWT recieved from the OAUTH server for an Integration Flow client in the Authorization Header, still getting the same 403 error.

The API provider created for the proxy uses Authentication type "Principal Propagation".

I would appreciate help in this matter.

entry.title: What does <Connectivity Service Unavailable> mean when connecting to a Private Cloud system?
entry.content:
We are currently encountering the error message '<Connectivity/ServiceUnavailable>: No se ha podido obtener el contenido debido a un error interno' when trying to connect our SAP BTP environment to an SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud system. Our setup includes properly configured destinations, as shown in the attached screenshots. However, the content channel creation fails, and we receive the mentioned connectivity error.

We speculate that this might be related to an internal SAP connectivity issue, or perhaps there is something specific we may have overlooked in our configuration.

Could anyone provide guidance on:

  • What specifically triggers the '' error?

  • Common configuration oversights that could lead to this issue?

  • Any steps we could take to verify our connectivity configuration or troubleshoot further?

We appreciate any insights or suggestions!

Thank you!

entry.title: ABAP Platform pipeline in SAP CI/CD Service - release issue
entry.content:
Hi, 

I have a problem with my ABAP Platform pipeline, using SAP Continuous Integration and Delivery Service in BTP. The issue is with the Release part.

I have a Cloud Connector and destination (using Principal Propagation) ready. The deployment from SAP BAS works as expected. All necessary OData Services are active and whitelisted. However, there's 401 error when the pipeline is executed.

[2025-07-29T14:59:03.441Z] Sending GET request to http://XXX:400/sap/opu/odata/UI5/ABAP_REPOSITORY_SRV/
[2025-07-29T14:59:03.677Z] Release stage credentials successfully validated against endpoint
...
[2025-07-29T14:59:23.345Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - No deploy dependencies provided. Skipping npm install call. Assuming current docker image already contains the dependencies for performing the deployment.
[2025-07-29T14:59:23.345Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - running shell script: /bin/sh #!/bin/sh -e
[2025-07-29T14:59:23.345Z] fiori deploy --failfast --yes --username ABAP_USER --password ABAP_PASSWORD --description "Pipeline Test" --config "ui5-deploy.yaml" --url http://XXX:400 --transport GXXXXXXXX --package Z_PACKAGE --name Z_TEST
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [32minfo[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Creating archive with UI5 build result.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [32minfo[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Archive created.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [32minfo[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Starting to deploy.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Deployment has failed.
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST Change logging level to debug your issue
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m abap-deploy-task Z_TEST 	(see examples https://github.com/SAP/open-ux-tools/tree/main/packages/deploy-tooling#configuration-with-logging-enabled)
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.278Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - [31merror[39m builder:custom deploy-to-abap Request failed with status code 401
[2025-07-29T14:59:24.279Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - Command deploy failed with error : Request failed with status code 401
[2025-07-29T14:59:42.331Z] info  transportRequestUploadCTS - fatal error: errorDetails{"category":"undefined","correlationId":"n/a","error":"running shell script failed with /bin/sh: cmd.Run() failed: exit status 1","library":"SAP/jenkins-library","message":"step execution failed","result":"failure","stepName":"transportRequestUploadCTS","time":"2025-07-29T14:59:39.890292594Z"}
[2025-07-29T14:59:42.332Z] fatal transportRequestUploadCTS - step execution failed - running shell script failed with /bin/sh: cmd.Run() failed: exit status 1

 I use Job Editor configuration mode. No code is used for the pipeline. 

Upload credentials is Basic Auth. using my Username and Password. These are no issues with it, as I've tested successfully.

I also use Cloud Connector, with Location ID specified on the destination level.

I have a couple of doubts:

- I see the --config "ui5-deploy.yaml" is used. Is there any special ui5-deploy content I have to add? I use destination there.

- Is ABAP Platform Endpoint the URL that I can find on my Destination level?

- Location ID - documentation says it should be found on the Cloud Connector level in BTP Cockpit, but it's false. There's Location ID, but only on the Destination level.

Any idea what could be the issue?

BR,

Adrian

entry.title: Just Started Learning SAP CPI ‚Äì Seeking Guidance to Grow Towards an Internship
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm a fresher who has just started learning SAP Cloud Integration (SAP CPI) through the SAP Learning platform. I‚Äôm very excited to explore this field and would love to build the skills needed to contribute to real integration projects in the future.

Since I‚Äôm completely new, I would appreciate your guidance on:

  • What beginner topics I should focus on first in SAP CPI

  • Any free practice systems, sample projects, or exercises you recommend

  • How I can gradually prepare myself for an internship role in this domain

I‚Äôm eager to learn, practice, and grow with advice from the SAP Community.

Thank you in advance for your support and suggestions! üôè

‚ÄîkadambalaSaikiran

entry.title: JDBC (Microsoft SQL) Connectivity issue In SAP CPI
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm trying to establish a connection to an on prem Microsoft SQL server via JDBC adapter in SAP CPI. I'm getting an error
org.springframework.jdbc.CannotGetJdbcConnectionException: Failed to obtain JDBC Connection; nested exception is com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The TCP/IP connection to the host localhost, port 1106 has failed. Error: "The driver received an unexpected pre-login response. Verify the connection properties and check that an instance of SQL Server is running on the host and accepting TCP/IP connections at the port. This driver can be used only with SQL Server 2005 or later.". ClientConnectionId:1fe33d15-3b89-41fa-b211-672cb643ff12, cause: com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerException: The TCP/IP connection to the host localhost, port 1106 has failed. Error: "The driver received an unexpected pre-login response. Verify the connection properties and check that an instance of SQL Server is running on the host and accepting TCP/IP connections at the port. This driver can be used only with SQL Server 2005 or later.". ClientConnectionId:1fe33d15-3b89-41fa-b211-672cb643ff12
The driver I've installed in CPI is V8.4.1

My JDBC configuration is 

Is this the correct driver version I'm using, and in the error, it mentions port as 1106, I've not maintained that port, why is it coming in the error? How do I resolve this error?

Please help.

Thanks in advance!
Shreyas.

entry.title: Business Application Studio Cannot See BTP Destinations (Platform Issue)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am facing a persistent issue where my Business Application Studio dev space is unable to see a BTP destination I've configured. The destination itself is set up correctly and the connection to my on-premise system is working perfectly, but it does not appear in the Fiori generator.

Environment:

  • BTP Environment: Trial Account

  • Region: US East (VA) - AWS

  • BAS Dev Space Type: SAP Fiori

Summary of the situation:

  1. I have successfully installed and configured the SAP Cloud Connector.

  2. I have created a destination in my BTP subaccount that connects to my on-premise SAP system. This destination has the required properties: HTML5.DynamicDestination = true and WebIDEUsage = odata_gen.

  3. Crucially, when I click the "Check Connection" button for this destination in the BTP Cockpit, the check is successful and returns a "200 OK - Backend is reachable" message. This confirms the entire end-to-end connection is working correctly.

  4. However, when I go into a Business Application Studio dev space and use the SAP Fiori generator, this destination does not appear in the "System" dropdown list.

  5. I have tried restarting the dev space, which did not solve the issue. I then deleted the dev space and created a brand new "SAP Fiori" dev space, and the destination is still not visible.

  6. When I run the diagnostic command npx fiori-tools destination in the terminal of the new dev space, I receive a DNS error:

    npm ERR! code ENOTFOUND
npm ERR! syscall getaddrinfo
npm ERR! errno ENOTFOUND
npm ERR! request to https://.../_.../destinations failed, reason: getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND ...

This ENOTFOUND error in a brand new dev space, combined with the successful connection check in the cockpit, strongly suggests a platform-level DNS or networking issue within the BAS environment for my trial account.

Could you please advise if this is a known issue or what the next steps should be? I believe I have exhausted all possible configuration and troubleshooting steps.

Thank you for your help.

entry.title: Migration of an HTML application from neo to cloud foundry environment
entry.content:
Hi All, 
I have a problem to solve. Recently, I migrated an HTML5 application from BTP neo to cloud foundry with the process guided on sap help portal. the application got migrated successfully and also, I migrated my destination from my BTP neo to cloud foundry environment in order to connect my application to backend. But when I preview my application, it shows the error in my ui5.yaml file.

Attached pictures are the screenshots of my ui5.yaml file.

Here's the detailed log of the error in my terminal when I'm using command "npm run start":

backend: [{"path":"/sap","url":"http://pvlhe4decc1.lthe.com:8101","client":"110","destination":"S4HANA_DEV"},{"path":"/api/UploadDocumentToSP","destination":"SharePoint","url":""},{"path":"/api/DownloadDocumentFromSP","destination":"SharePoint","url":""}]

Error

Can someone help me with this error?





Regards,

Abhishek

entry.title: Best Practices for Enforcing API Governance for Applications Co-located with S/4HANA in Same Cloud I
entry.content:
I have an architectural question regarding API governance and security:

Current Scenario:

  • S/4HANA On-Premise system deployed in AWS cloud infrastructure
  • External applications accessing S/4HANA On-Premise OData/APIs are properly governed through:
    • SAP Cloud Connector (for BTP applications)
    • API Management (for external platform applications)

Challenge: Applications deployed in the same AWS infrastructure as S/4HANA On-Premise can potentially access the OData services/APIs directly, bypassing any API governance layer. This creates a security and governance gap. 

 Questions:

  1. What are the recommended approaches to ensure all API access to S/4HANA On-Premise is properly governed, even for co-located applications?
  2. Are there any reference architectures or best practices for implementing API governance within the same cloud infrastructure
  3. How can we enforce the use of API Management or similar governance layer for applications in the same network?

    Any guidance, documentation links, or reference architectures would be greatly appreciated.

    Thanks in advance !


    [Attached simplified architecture diagram showing the scenario]

entry.title: Provision of Sales Cloud V2 APIs via Integration Suite and Cloud Connector for on-prem clients
entry.content:
Dear colleagues,

As part of our ongoing platform transformation, we are migrating to Sales Cloud V2 and S/4HANA. Initial testing within our sandbox environment has confirmed successful access to the Sales Cloud V2 APIs.

For productive use, we aim to establish a secure and scalable integration architecture by leveraging SAP Integration Suite in conjunction with the Cloud Connector. This setup is intended to enable on-premise clients to proactively consume Sales Cloud V2 APIs.

The envisioned scenario involves external calls initiated from on-prem systems, with responses returned from the cloud ‚Äî for example, accessing data related to the Business Partner object.

We would like to validate whether this architecture is technically feasible and aligns with best practices for hybrid connectivity and secure API exposure.

entry.title: Principal propagation in sap CPI to ECC
entry.content:
HI Members,

Hope you are doing well.

i have scenario as external system is sending data to SAP CPI from there it should reach to ECC via Cloud connector and do the transaction with same user as external system sent. where external system is using basic authentication and message is reaching to sap CPI but when request is going to ECC it giving error as "no identity configured for the user" . same user existed in sap ecc but its failing even we used the principal propagation setup in ECC and cert mapping in ECC.

 Can you please help me with details to do the principal propagation in SAP CPI to ECC .

Thanks & Regards

Madhu

entry.title: Principal Propagation failing between BTP Mobile Services, Cloud Connector and S/4 HANA - Access Den
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm experiencing an issue with Principal Propagation when connecting SAP Mobile Development Kit (MDK) application through BTP Mobile Services to an on-premise S/4 HANA system via Cloud Connector.

Current Setup:

  • Source: SAP Mobile Services (BTP)
  • Middleware: SAP Cloud Connector
  • Target: SAP S/4 HANA on-premise (Client 400)

Problem Description:

When I configure the connection in Mobile Services to use "Cloud Connector SSO" as the SSO mechanism and try to test it using the "Launch in Browser" button, I receive the following error:

 
Access denied to system molinos.rise:8000. In case this was a valid request, ensure to expose the system correctly in your cloud connector.

However, the same OData service works perfectly when:

  1. Accessed directly from the S/4 HANA system browser
  2. Using a BTP Destination with Basic Authentication (username/password)

But it fails when using Principal Propagation authentication method.

Current Configuration:

Cloud Connector:

  • Principal Type: X.509 Certificate
  • Resources: / exposed with "Path And All Sub-Paths"

Connection to S/4 HANA: ‚úÖ Active

What I've Already Checked:

‚úÖ Cloud Connector can reach S/4 HANA system (green status) ‚úÖ OData service is active in SICF ‚úÖ Resource "/" is exposed in Cloud Connector ‚úÖ Virtual-to-internal host mapping is correct ‚úÖ Basic Authentication works (confirms the OData service itself is working) ‚úÖ Cloud Connector certificate appears to be in STRUST

Questions:

  • Is there any additional trust configuration needed between BTP, Cloud Connector, and S/4 HANA for X.509 certificate-based SSO?
  • Are there any specific authorizations my user needs in S/4 HANA to consume OData services via Principal Propagation? (Besides the standard OData consumption authorizations)

How can I verify that the Cloud Connector is correctly sending the certificate/user information to S/4 HANA?

Logs/Additional Info:

The error appears immediately when clicking "Launch in Browser" in Mobile Services. The Cloud Connector audit log shows the request is being blocked at the Cloud Connector level with the "Access denied" message.

Any guidance on the correct configuration steps or troubleshooting approach would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you in advance for your help.

Best regards

entry.title: Connection Issue Between SAP BTP Trial and S/4HANA On-Premise via Cloud Connector
entry.content:
Hi All,

I‚Äôm currently configuring the connectivity between our SAP BTP free trial account and our S/4HANA on-premise system using the Cloud Connector. After completing the setup, I tried to validate the connection between the cloud and on-premise systems, but I encountered an error.

Upon checking the related SAP Note, it seems that the issue might be due to a possible spelling mistake in the host name or a connectivity issue with the internal host.

I have verified that the internal hostname and port are correct, and I also checked in SICF in on-premise system to ensure the correct internal host and port are maintained. However, the connection is still not working. I‚Äôm using an HTTPS connection.

Could you please help me resolve this issue?

BR/Kannan.

entry.title: Integration Suite Cloud Connector Connectivity Test fails
entry.content:
I'm trying to set up Cloud Connector to my BTP and Integration Suite so I can access SMB shares on an internal Windows 11 server.

Everything I can see the status of, looks like everything is working except it seems Integration Suite isn't talking to BTP,  maybe.

Here are screenshots of everything I have running.

Cloud Connector on Windows Machine

This windows machine has confirmed access to the SMB file share I want to get files from.

Tested in PowerShell and basic authentication user name and password are verified working.

‚ÄÉ

Status of that cloud connector

‚ÄÉStatus of connection in BTP

I set up a "Destination" in BTP as a test as well just to see and that checks out.

But, now In integration suite if I try and use this in a SMB Adapter in an iFlow I get errors (some details obscured, my company is very sensitive)

All of the parameters are 100% correct (as long as this is what is supposed to go there).

Address is the virtual address I have set up.

Location ID is the Location ID is have set up in Cloud Connector on the Windows Machine

Share is the name of the Share Drive I'm trying to access via SMB on the Windows Machine

Credentials Name is set up and deployed and verified as correct username and password that can access the SMB share at the destination.

"org.apache.camel.CamelException: <Exception><Message>Error in Session connect: On-Premise connection failed for bXX-XXX:445. Ensure cloud connector is configured correctly for location id : us-XXX-XXX and host is exposed correctly in your cloud connector. SMB uses TCP as protocol. Error : SOCKS5 command failed with status: NETWORK_UNREACHABLE</Message></Exception>"

Also, in Integration Suite, if I go to "Monitor->Manage Security->Connectivity Tests->Cloud Connector"

and put in my location ID the only feedback I get is "Could not connect to Cloud Connector" error.

Not sure how to proceed to try and get this working.

entry.title: Unable to authenticate backend system from SAP BAS via Cloud Connector ‚Äì ‚ÄúAuthentication incorrect‚Äù
entry.content:
Hello Experts!!

I am trying to consume an on-premise S/4HANA system from SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) using SAP Cloud Connector and a BTP Destination.

The Cloud Connector connection is reachable, and the Destination is visible inside BAS, but when I select the destination (‚ÄúS4H‚Äù) in the SAP Fiori Generator wizard, BAS returns the error:


"Authentication incorrect. Please check the SAP BTP destination authentication configuration."

Even when I remove authentication from the BTP Destination and directly enter credentials in the BAS wizard, the same error appears.

I can successfully log in to the S/4HANA backend via SAP GUI with the same user and password, and the SAP Easy Access screen loads correctly.
However, BAS / Cloud Connector authentication fails.

entry.title: Datasphere: Issues creating data federation connection between datasphere and S/4hana on-prem
entry.content:
Hi guys,

we¬¥re currently in the process of connecting our datasphere to S/4HANA on-Prem using ABAP SQL services for data federation. We¬¥re struggling to establish the connection with S/4HANA

During setup we followed the official documentation:

  • Cloud Connector: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/9f804b8efa8043539289f42f372c4862/f289920243a34127b0c8b13012a1a4b5.html?locale=en-US
  • ABAP SQL Services: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/9f804b8efa8043539289f42f372c4862/4d7474595a5b41bb986616262ff44a3a.html?locale=en-US

 

We get the following error message when trying to import remote tables in datasphere.

 

According to SAP Note 3076454 we have to install the ODBC driver on S4. However S4 team informed us no ODBC is required on S4 side but the pre-installed in datasphere is sufficient. Hence I¬¥m a bit confused whether ODBC is needed on S4 for our scenario, any thoughts from your side?

In addition we have already checked Note 3586001 (https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/3586001), but haven¬¥t been able to resolve this matter.

 

We¬¥ve already double checked:

  • Cloud connector settings
  • Firewall (hanacloud.ondemand.com / k8s-hana.ondemand.com) and whitelisting all necessary IPs

Everything seems fine.

 

The S4 connection is validated reachable in cloud connector.

 

We looked into the cloud connector logs and see a failing handshake request and terminated connection due to SSL/TLS communication. Any advice how to approach this matter further? Looks to me we might have some certificate issues between cloud connector ‚Äì BTP ‚Äì Datapshere - S4, but that¬¥s not really my area of expertise.

 

Any help appreciated!

entry.title: Connect to Onprem LDAP Destination from CAP (Nodejs) App running in K8s cluster???
entry.content:
Hi All,

We have a requirement where we have to display users when a Cost Center value is entered.

We are looking to use LDAP protocol to fetch user details and have a working setup locally via ldap client

We have Kubernetes setup where we deploy our applications. We are looking for documentation/ gudance on how to connect to this on prem destination with SAP BTP connectivity service.

We use Transparent proxy, connectivity proxy intalled in the cluster and Destination and Connectivity services, cloud connector from BTP.

Though there is SAP help documentation, we dont have much clarity on how this can be done in CAP.

Looking forward for suggestions/support if someone has already implemented it.

We also interested in knowing if Default SAP IDP provides API's using which we can fetch the user data.

Thanks in Advance.

entry.title: How to Export Analytical Model Output from SAP Datasphere to Azure Data Lake Storage?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on a requirement where I need to export the output of an Analytical Model in SAP Datasphere into Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS).

Connections to both Datasphere and Azure are already established.

Question:
Is there a way to export Analytical Model data into ADLS?

I attempted to create a Replication Flow with Datasphere as the source. However, when selecting the source object, I only see:

  • Local Tables

  • Fact Views

  • Dimension Views

The Analytical Models do not appear as selectable source objects.

Has anyone implemented this scenario or knows if Analytical Models are supported in Replication Flows or if there is an alternative approach?

Thanks in advance!

 

SAP Datasphere Cloud Integration Cloud Connector

entry.title: Setup cloud connector to connect to non sap on premise application with 2 way ssl
entry.content:

I am new to the cloud connector topic and looking for a confirmation if cloud connector can setup 2 way SSL with on prem servers and authenticate using the client certificate authentication method for https connections. 

I checked sap help pages but did not find the relevant information to further confirm this setup. If possible, share any blog or help links for step by step guide.

Thanks for your time.

Regards,

Rahul
